admission_requirements.summary: The provided text lists five Bachelor of Science (BSc) degrees and one Bachelor of Optometry (B.Optom) degree, all related to specialized healthcare fields including Cardiac Care, Operation Theatre, Optometry, Radiology & Imaging, Renal Dialysis, and Medical Laboratory Technology.
admission_requirements.raw_content:
• BSc (Cardiac Care Technology)
• BSc (Operation Theatre Technology)
• B.Optom (Bachelor of Optometry)
• BSc (Radiology & Imaging Technology)
• BSc (Renal Dialysis Technology)
• BSc Medical Laboratory Technology

school_details.summary: The School of Allied Health Sciences (SOAHS) at Noida International University, associated with a 750-bedded multispecialty hospital, aims to improve global health through teaching, research, and patient care. It seeks to produce skilled healthcare professionals, foster research for advancing healthcare practices and policies, and provide person-centered care focused on patient outcomes and well-being. The SOAHS offers a diverse range of courses taught by experienced faculty, with a curriculum designed to meet industry needs, complemented by interactive learning opportunities and early exposure to a hospital environment. Graduates are prepared for various rewarding careers, and the school plays an integral role in transforming healthcare.
school_details.raw_content:
The School of Allied Health Sciences associated with the on-campus 750 bedded NIIMS multispecialty hospital is to improve the health and wellbeing of all nations through exemplary and culturally sensitive teaching, innovative research, and patient care. The Institute of Allied Health Sciences envisages producing a diverse, interprofessionally skilled workforce of healthcare practitioners, educators, researchers, and healthcare leaders. Our college of health sciences aims to conduct research to generate new knowledge that advances the practices and policies of health care.
The in-campus hospital provides the science and practice of person-centred care with a focus on patient outcomes, families, communities, integrative health care, health promotion/disease prevention, and the improvement of overall quality of life.
Throughout our teaching, research, and clinical care, we are committed to engagement with diverse student, faculty, and patient populations to create an inclusive and enriching environment for learning. All Allied Health Sciences Courses are offered, and taught by the best allied health sciences faculties.
As Dean of the School of Allied Health Sciences at Noida International University, I extend a most sincere welcome to all prospective students.
Accounting for nearly two-thirds of the entire health workforce, allied health professionals practice individually and in interdisciplinary teams to provide an extraordinary range of diagnostic, technical, therapeutic, and direct patient care. Allied with one another, as well as with medicine and nursing, the professions represented within the School of Allied Health Sciences work to improve the quality of life for patients, their families, and their communities.
Our graduates assume rewarding careers as dieticians, medical technologists, physical and occupational therapists, clinical and rehabilitation counsellors, and radiographers, among others. With such diversity, the SOAHS role is integral in transforming health care, not just nationally or internationally but also in local communities.
I am proud to support our mission and to represent the talented and diverse students, faculty, and staff who make SOAHS so vital and important. I urge you to take a few moments to explore our many programs and services.
• An industry needs a based, designed curriculum with inputs from top academic & professional bodies.
• Interactive sessions, workshops, seminars, paper presentations, and quizzes.
• 750 bedded on- campus Multi-Speciality hospital with all modern facilities and experienced faculty.
• An early exposure to the hospital environment with hands-on training for students

events.summary: This compilation lists various events, reports, and academic activities, primarily within the healthcare and education sectors. It includes a range of medical topics such as liver function testing, ergonomics, palliative care, ophthalmology, physiotherapy, and specific procedures like Percutaneous Transluminal Coronary Angioplasty. The list also highlights awareness drives, industry visits, workshops, and student achievements, indicating a focus on professional development, community outreach, and academic engagement.
